My method is super straight forward.
Be in Buzzard, start Takeover.
Fly straight into the hangar making sure your weapons do not lock on until you're close (locking on triggers the cops)
Blast the people in the hangar, usually two missions kills everyone. Sometimes it takes a 3rd missile.
skid to a halt and let the Buzzard grab the case as your come in hot.
fly away.
This didn't work for the couple of cars I've tried so far. I'm guessing it's selective and not universal. Oh well.
It sometimes means they're still loading in to Online or that they're playing single player.

I didn't read the other comments but the most confusing thing is how thefts next to or behind you seem to be CLOSER. do not be fooled. It only appears closer because the radar's center is at the bottom of the phone screen. So that dot down at the bottom that suddenly seems really close, is not close. It's just nearer to the center because of the screen's offset.
So only pay attention to the dot that is ahead of you, and if THAT dot is close to your radar's center, then that means the vehicle is close.

About a year or so ago, I took a break from GTAO because a buddy was trying to get me into Destiny. It was a hard battle for him cuz I was *REALLY* into gta. But eventually I began playing Destiny and after some people I met in-game took me through a couple of raids, I got hooked. I tabled GTAO before the MC DLC came out, right around the ill-gotten gains dlc.
I started playing Destiny single player a lot at first but then got really into the Raids. Eventually I began playing the role of Sherpa for randoms and started taking new players through the raids and showing them where to go, what to do, and introducing them to the game mechanics that are unique in each raid. In these sessions, it's normal for players to die repeatedly and having to restart was expected.
When I wasn't playing Sherpa for new players, I'd just join raid groups and blow through them every week before the weekly reset. Every once in a while on these raid groups of experienced players, you'd always get a guy who was vouching for a new player. "He's never done it but he's good at it. It won't be hard" they'd implore. Ok fine so I'm a group of six, we'd have 5 experienced guys and one n00b.
In these situations I really wouldn't have that much patience. If the noob messed up and died more than a handful of times I'd bounce. Sorry fellas. I didn't sign on today to play Sherpa. I thought we were just trying to get through this quickly.
I can imagine the frustration of these types of failures when it's Pac Standard and all you want to do is finish it but you're stuck because the noob is a friend of a friend.
That must've really sucked. Sorry, bro.

WRITING.TITLE: When is it good to have a full lobby while doing CEO work?...
WRITING.TEXT:
I was happily delivering a full large warehouse of special crates in a peaceful solo-public lobby. It was the three-Brickade mission that involves only one delivery each, with use of the Trafficky app.
I deliver the first two and while in transit with the third, I see a notification on my screen in the lower left. "So-and-so killed so-and-so"
Oh crap. The lobby is filling up! I hope I make it to my destination without getting wrecked.
Checking the map it looks like everyone is nowhere near downtown (where I'm headed.) I make it to my destination unmolested and because 13 people flooded into my lobby I got a total of $3,135,750 instead of the usual $2,220,000 or even the $2,775,000 for the 25% bonus event!
That's one time I was glad the lobby filled up last-minute! (It must be nice being those CEO friendly lobby dudes if this is what they see all the time!)

Instead of making your goal to buy something, make your goal to hit a dollar amount. I was at $60M and didn't want to go below it. So I had to earn in order to buy anything. And then I decided to not go under $70M. And now I'm sitting at $78M trying for $80M.

The weight distribution was kinda flawed with the engine, transmission and the like being behind the driver, leaving little weight to push the front tires down. So, in a turn the tires could easily lose grip causing the terrible oversteer.
A mid-engine setup that provides a 50/50 weight distribution is not "flawed." It's actually ideal.
Also, even if you were losing grip in the front tires in a turn, that wouldn't cause oversteer. That would result in understeer.

WRITING.TITLE: Players these days are so spoiled
WRITING.TEXT:
Have people forgotten that we used to NOT HAVE a blue corona in our garages? That we used to have to re-arrange our cars manually by driving them in an out with a filler street car?
They probably also forgot that we used to not even be able to jog in our garages and apartments. Everything was walking only.
That we didn't have the ability to customize our mini maps and hide a gazillion icons?
I swear new players today are so spoiled by all the options they're given. Oh and get off my lawn, kids! Lol :-D

If you can't wait, you can rearrange your cars the way we all used to do it BEFORE Rockstar gave us the ability to rearrange cars. Just put in a filler car, and move stuff in and out until you have it the way you want it.

This will probably get downvoted but if I was that kid, never did heists before, tried my best at the setups with randoms and finally made it to the finale where I'm stuck doing this drill thing that -- if it's your first time -- is pretty tricky, then the random that i thought was my partner just left out of impatience, I would be kind of upset too.
How many times have people complained on this sub that randoms bail mid-heist and ruin it for everyone else?
Rockstar give these types of people bad sports points for a reason.
Try it and tell us
Can you explain the story mode glitch you're referring to?

Easiest way:
PS4 menu settings internet setting set up internet connection choose custom instead of easy
Select all default settings by hitting X
When you get to MTU settings, change it from default 1500 to either 800 or 900. I use 900 but both work.
Hit X to accept and back out to game. No need to test internet settings unless you want to.
Super reliable, always solo. It usually stays solo for 6-7 or 8 hours before anyone joins. It's less ironclad if you invite a friend, although I find that if you stay away from your friend (like if you do CEO work in the city and he's in Blaine County doing MC work) it will still last a long time before anyone else joins.

but you can slowly increase it by not dying.

Aside from the bike bomb strategy, you can go behind the bar and you'll more or less fight one guy at a time as they come at you single file. The trick is to not pinch too many times or you end up with the enemy behind you (and his buddy will flank!)

I steal a motorcycle off the street (I used to keep at least one stolen bike in my garage for this purpose but I ran out of space) and throw one sticky bomb on it.
I drive it in and park it near the doorway. Everyone ignores you until you throw a punch or hold L1 (targeting)
Now that everyone is trying to fight you, go back up the steps to the exit and lure them there.
Get to a safe distance and trigger it.
It might not kill everyone but the fire will kill some more. Now you can either grab the supplies which has been dropped or fight one or two survivors who are carrying it.
That's true
If you don't like how there aren't many mods on a car, don't get the Contender. Omg. So pissed.

WRITING.TEXT: So just the usual GTA stuff.

I don't mean to be argumentative, but if you're looking for experience, here's mine: I lost a vehicle and contacted rockstar support. Next day, they refunded me the full amount (+$2.4M) PLUS another $100,000 for my troubles.
That's my experience with R* support. I would hardly st they're "dead."
So if it's Redditors' user experiences you're looking for, I still suggest you contact them about your account.

and NO, contacting rockstar games is stupid cause they're support is dead
Reddit should be a last resort after support couldn't help. Not the other way around. How are Redditors supposed to have access to your account and help you in any way?
You mean Johann Wickersham? He's my favorite Dutch crime fighting assassin.

Some missions allow solo and they're totally doable. Some require more people. Just start a new session to get a new set of contracts. Contracts are lobby-wide. So everyone in the lobby would theoretically get the same missions choices. It's like a classified section of the paper.
If you simply looked up the newswire you would see it ends May 15. That two words you need to google. "rockstar" and "newswire"

I got on yesterday for the first time for the exact same reason; the tron bike. I did Deadline 2. I don't know if that matters but someone said deadline 1 is less popular.
Anyway, I got on in the first try.
And if you're on a console and used to doing solo public lobby tricks, just make sure you change your internet settings back to normal or people will have a hard time joining.
Probably either something on your end or your ISP.

This depends on what you mean by "worth it"
*Is it the highest $/minute earner?* No.
*Will you make your investment back quickly?* Depends on how much you play, but I say yes. And probably in three or four day's play time.
*will you actually profit a meaningful amount? Like in order to start buying super cars and other cool stuff?* yes and no. Ideally if you have a coke business, you're also running it with other MC businesses or CEO work. If you do combine businesses, you will start making more money than you know what to do with. I mean if you play 4-5 hours a day, you will start making around a million dollars every day.
I have CEO car warehouse; small medium and large crate warehouses; a coke, meth, weed, and counterfeit business. No forgery biz. I heard it's unprofitable.
Yesterday I played for about 4-5 hours sourcing and delivering various things that were at various stages of capacity. I also went AFK for a good while during NBA playoffs and ended up making $1.7-$1.8M before turning off the PlayStation.
You have to start investing in these businesses in order to start making money. There's no quick cash solution and there's no way around it. Just get your feet wet and start hustling. The money will come and it will hit you hard. I will even get to the point where you'd rather shut down a business and cut off the cash for a bit because there are too many things to think about. That's sort of where I am right now haha
Edit: I should also add that -- to me -- it's way more fun than CEO work. It also makes more sense lore-wise. Why would a big CEO tycoon drive a trash truck to deliver drugs? The head of a biker gang who has chemists under his employment producing meth while he goes to fetch more supplies? That makes more sense. And occasionally he has to kill some cops and a narc who's about to rat out his coke business. To me that's all way more fun than the CEO grind. Seriously, fuck that 3-crate sourcing mission with the crashed plane up in Malibu.

I said in my post that I've shared cash before. Plenty of times.
But this stat reads as $0. Also I'm pretty sure I've received cash from shared money after jobs before too. But the stat that reads "received from others" also reads $0.
So unless it's bugged, that can't be what it means.

I don't buy 3 at a time as that takes a large chunk out your profits.
You need to evaluate this as $/minute not dollar per returns. Yes, $2000 per crate x8 is only $16,000. But if you do $6000 per two crates, you only need to do it 4 times and spend $24,000.
8 trips versus 4 trips means you can sell TWO sets of 8 in the time you normally sell only one set.
So if you like selling 8-crates at a time, that's $48,000 invested in $160,000 earnings in the same amount of time as $16,000 for $80,000.
You net $122,000 doing two-crates-at-a-time in the same amount of trips as $64,000 for one-crate purchases.

I usually jump in the titan or whatever plane so the destination checkpoints show up on the map. Then I hop out and get in a Hydra and do a quick reconnaissance run near those checkpoints to check for and clear any enemies. Then I come back to fly the Titan or whatever. There's plenty of time to do that.
Your other option if you encounter enemies, is to land the plane and fight them. Then continue the drops.
Last resort, abort the mission by disconnecting your internet (or closing the app abruptly, making sure the game does not have time to save) and then resupply your missing crates (you'll just lose three) and try again, hoping for a different mission.

WRITING.TITLE: In your social club stats, there is a metric for amount of money "given to others"...
WRITING.TEXT:
... what is that? I've been playing since launch and am currently at level 464 and my "money given to others" stat is exactly $0.
I've 'shared money from last job' before but that's not what this is. Anyone have any clue?
He spawns there in front of the Manns Chinese Theater all the time. Nothing special

What people have said is pac standard grinding is still the highest dollar per hour. But obviously that depends on how fast you are. The rough formula here is Headhunter, hostile takeover at LSIA, and Sightseer -- in this order! -- with CEO work in between each.

That was a funny one to talk about. But no way was that the best.
The best was the first:
get modded car and go to LSC
sell car and immediately go to buy shark card screen
go back to game and find your duplicate car on the street and your new money in your wallet.
repeat. no cool down. Profit.
I easily made $100,000,000 at least because of this glitch. Maybe more.
Still, that's half a million overnight while sleeping. So that's not bad!
